intro: Malvastrum modioliforme, commonly known as the silverleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy, globe-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the stems are typically hairy and sprawling. Malvastrum modioliforme is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus.
